= Components =
(generated)


*Component items*:
  * *Parasympathetic uterus vasodilators (uterus-parasympathetic)*: female - contraction of smooth muscles of myometrium, increased blood flow; sexual response by directing blood flow to the pelvis and to the external genitalia, including the ovaries, vagina, labia, and clitoris
  * *Parasympathetic vaginal vasodilators (vagina-parasympathetic)*: female - contraction of smooth muscles of myometrium, increased blood flow
  * *Utetovaginal visceral receptors (utetovaginal-visceral-receptors)*: sexual sensations
  * *Corpus cavernosum clitoridis (corpus-cavernosum-clitoridis)*: clitoral erection; simultaneously the ischiocavernosus and bulbospongiosus muscles compress the veins of the corpora cavernosa restricting the egress and circulation of this blood
  * *Corpus cavernosum penis (corpus-cavernosum-penis)*: penile erection; simultaneously the ischiocavernosus and bulbospongiosus muscles compress the veins of the corpora cavernosa restricting the egress and circulation of this blood
  * *Visceral sexual receptors (visceral-sexual-receptors)*: sexual sensations
  * *Bulbospongiosus muscle (bulbospongiosus-muscle)*: in males, empties the urethra; in females, clenches the vagina
  * *External sphincter muscle of female urethra (external-sphincter-female-urethra)*: control urination, constricts urethra, maintain urinary continence
  * *External sphincter muscle of male urethra (external-sphincter-male-urethra)*: control urination, constricts urethra, maintain urinary continence
  * *Ischiocavernosus muscle (ischiocavernosus-muscle)*: stabilize the erect penis or (in females) tense the vagina during orgasm
